frame.name: Firefighting
frame.definition: <def-root>This frame characterizes the situation or state of affairs in which someone acts to prevent a Fire_disaster from occurring, accelerating, or affecting any area not identified as a Controlled_area. The named Burn_area, targeted by the Fire_disaster, is more salient than "fire" itself and is often used for reference instead. The organizational methods for Firefighting are of utmost importance in this frame.</def-root>

FE.name: Firefighter
FE.definition: <def-root>The individual or group who respond(s) to the <fen>Fire</fen>.</def-root>

FE.name: Time
FE.definition: <def-root>The time when the Firefighter fights the Fire.</def-root>

FE.name: Place
FE.definition: <def-root>This FE identifies the location of the Firefighters as they attempt to fight the Fire.</def-root>

FE.name: Manner
FE.definition: <def-root>The manner in which the Firefighters are fighting the Fire.</def-root>

FE.name: Purpose
FE.definition: <def-root>The desired result of the firefight. It may either directly refer to the state of affairs that is desired, e.g. <ex>The <fex name="Firefighter">firefighters</fex> <t>tackled</t> the <fex name="Fire">blaze</fex> early <fex name="Purpose">to prevent the further spread of the flames.</fex></ex> or the state of affairs may be implicit in an (abstract or concrete) entity that is desired by the firefighters, e.g. <ex>The <fex name="Firefighter">firefighters</fex> <t>fought</t> <fex name="Purpose">for ground</fex> as the <fex name="Fire">flames</fex> approached.</ex></def-root>

FE.name: Instrument
FE.definition: <def-root>An instrument with which an intentional fire-fighting act is performed.</def-root>

FE.name: Depictive
FE.definition: <def-root>This FE describes a participant of the state of affairs as being in some state during the firefighting action. </def-root>

lexUnit.name: fight.v
lexUnit.definition: FN: Making an attempt to put a fire out with great effort. Usually attempted by official Firefighters.

lexUnit.name: gain ground.idio
lexUnit.definition: FN: To advance a firefighting effort into territory that was previously burning, or was thought to be burning. Most often used to describe advances made on wildfires burning in non-urban areas.

lexUnit.name: battle.n
lexUnit.definition: FN: A firefighting effort where the outcome is not guaranteed.

lexUnit.name: control.v
lexUnit.definition: FN: Firefighting unit prevents a blaze from reaching a critical moment at which it may cause expensive, irreparable, or otherwise undesirable damage.

lexUnit.name: tackle.v
lexUnit.definition: FN: Firefighting unit aggressively pushes forward toward a fire so that it can be doused before causing any more damage than it might already have caused.

lexUnit.name: attack.v
lexUnit.definition: FN: Employ firefighters and firefighting equipment in a concentrated effort against a fire.

lexUnit.name: battle.v
lexUnit.definition: FN: A team fights a fire with no indication of weakness but no clear indication of imminent success.

lexUnit.name: fire fighting.n
lexUnit.definition: FN: to process of extinguishing fires
